Though the yaoi and hentai communities in the U.S are growing, and that at a 
very fast pace, I'd say.
I remember when I first got into yaoi, there was hardly anything to find on 
it, but now...man, there's tons. ^^ Which makes me perfectly happy. 
heeheehee..
I hope though, that they'll continue to expand. Would be a pity if it 
didn't. Though yuri seems to be very acceptable, 'specially in Little Tokyo 
here in Los Angeles. @_@ There were shelves full of that stuff, anime and 
manga alike.


Miser Bellatrix

"Allow me to give you a hand...with your doom."

-----------------------------

yes, 3-hajime's counter is WAAAY off the charts:)

the girls on 3-hajime are obsessing over those collectible
shinsengumi figures which can double as cake decorations

I like their take on fundoshi...babelfish says "scrupulous" as a
description for historical S.H....I don't understand what they are
saying regarding the towel wound around the neck though which is
another quirk associated with hist. S.H. too :(

In Thailand there are many bootleg translations however now many
official copies have a special holographic sticker to show that it
is licensed etc

I wonder if manga continues to expand its territory in U.S. if it
will have the same problem as in Thailand...the government is/was
very concerned about yaoi/hentai and for a time manga was just
labelled as evil altogether because *very* young kids were reading
hentai...one case an adolescent was charged with sexual/physical
assault and police investigated his room to find it filled with
hentai and so an association was made.
